comments.text: It is common to copy/paste a password from an email into a password field in the browser. It is also commonly difficult to highlight just the password; often leading and/or trailing whitespace (especially spaces and newlines) are selected accidentally. It is exceedingly rare that a password has leading or trailing whitespace (though, internal whitespace may be more common). Since password fields are obscured with asterisks, it isn't clear to the user that these unintended characters are being included as part of the password.

comments.text:
We could also just show spaces as spaces (or a dimmed dot?). But I think just stripping that spaces on pasted values would be simplest.

Should make sure we do this for XUL password fields too (eg HTTP auth).

comments.text: Trailing whitespace is especially common because many programs (including Firefox) select any trailing space when you double-click a word to select it. It is frustrating because some websites are smart and trim leading/trailing whitespace for you, so double-click+copy+paste works for them, but others don't.
